required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Lanreotide Autogel in Non-functioning Entero-pancreatic Endocrine Tumours
clinical_study.official_title: Phase III, Randomised, Double-blind, Stratified Comparative, Placebo Controlled, Parallel Group, Multi-centre Study to Assess the Effect of Deep Subcutaneous Injections of Lanreotide Autogel 120mg Administered Every 28 Days on Tumour Progression Free Survival in Patients With Non-functioning Entero-pancreatic Endocrine Tumour

brief_summary.textblock: The study will compare the difference between lanreotide Autogel and placebo on progression free survival in patients who have an endocrine tumour in the pancreas or intestines.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From randomisation up to the last tumour assessment (scheduled at 96 weeks). Radiological scans were performed every 12 weeks during the first year and every 24 weeks during the second year
primary_outcome.description: Time from randomization to first documentation of disease progression, or death. Disease progression centrally assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST) v1.0

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Alive & Without Disease Progression
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients still ongoing (or completing at Week 96) without centrally assessed disease progression or death at Weeks 48 and 96.
Pharmacokinetic Profile of Lanreotide assessed by mean serum concentration at specified timepoints

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Global Health Status Quality of Life Assessment
secondary_outcome.description: Transformed scores from European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) Quality of Life Questionnaire responses (QLQ)-C30. Questionnaire response scores range from 0 to 100. Higher scores indicate best possible Quality of Life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With a Greater Than or Equal to 50% Decrease in Plasma Chromogranin A (CgA) Levels
Percentage of Patients Still Alive Based on Available Overall Survival Data
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomisation to death or last visit, up to 321 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival defined as the time from randomisation to death due to any cause. Subjects were followed for overall survival beyond study completion/withdrawal via annual telephone contact until the last subject completed the study.

intervention.description: 120mg administered via deep subcutaneous injection every 28 days for a maximum period of 96 weeks.
Saline solution 0.9% administered via deep subcutaneous injection every 28 days for a maximum period of 96 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Endocrine tumour in the intestine or pancreas and with locally advanced or metastatic disease
- No hormone related symptoms
- Well or moderately differentiated tumour confirmed by histology
- Tumour lesions which are measurable by a CT or MRI scan
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previously treated with a somatostatin analogue unless more than 6 months ago and given for no more than 15 days
- Treated within the last 6 months with interferon, chemoembolisation or chemotherapy or at any time with a radionuclide
- Had a previous cancer except basal cell carcinoma and/or in situ carcinoma of the cervix/uterus and/or patients treated with curative intent and free from disease for 5 years
- Pregnant or lactating
- Females must use adequate contraception during the study

results_reference.citation: Caplin ME, Pavel M, Ćwikła JB, Phan AT, Raderer M, Sedláčková E, Cadiot G, Wolin EM, Capdevila J, Wall L, Rindi G, Langley A, Martinez S, Blumberg J, Ruszniewski P; CLARINET Investigators. Lanreotide in metastatic enteropancreatic neuroendocrine tumors. N Engl J Med. 2014 Jul 17;371(3):224-33. doi: 10.1056/NEJMoa1316158.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 264 subjects were screened at 48 investigational sites in 14 countries (Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, France, Germany, India, Italy, Poland, Slovakia, Spain, Sweden, United Kingdom and the United States of America). 204 subjects were randomised to receive study treatment in the Intent to treat (ITT) population.

group.title: Lanreotide (Autogel Formulation)
group.description: 120mg administered via deep subcutaneous injection every 28 days for a maximum period of 96 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo: Saline solution 0.9% administered via deep subcutaneous injection every 28 days for a maximum period of 96 weeks.

participants_list.participants: Patients who completed specified assessments or met primary efficacy endpoint criteria for an event.

baseline.population: Analysis based on intent-to-treat (ITT) population comprised of 204 subjects.

measure.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
measure.description: Time from randomization to first documentation of disease progression, or death. Disease progression centrally assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST) v1.0

measurement_list.measurement: Not available as median not reached during the 96 week fixed duration study.

analysis.p_value_desc: No p-value adjustment for multiple comparisons.
analysis.method_desc: The log rank test was stratified according to progression status at baseline and prior therapy.

outcome.description: Percentage of patients still ongoing (or completing at Week 96) without centrally assessed disease progression or death at Weeks 48 and 96.
outcome.population: Analysis based on the intent-to-treat (ITT) population which comprised 204 randomised subjects.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
